printWriter.write("<some_nested_tag attr=\"HI\">");

<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are writing string without a line break. But BufferedReader expects one of the line characters mentioned above which you are not providing. It does output the whole buffer once the end of the stream is reached though. To fix this, you can use the PrintWriter class to write the xml data to the file. You can write the opening and closing tags of the xml, then write the content of the tags and finally write the closing tags. This way you can ensure that the xml data is properly formatted and can be read by other xml parsers.
